info.title: AzureDeploymentManager
info.description: REST APIs for orchestrating deployments using the Azure Deployment Manager (ADM). See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/deployment-manager-overview for more information.

put.summary: Creates or updates a service topology.
put.description: Synchronously creates a new service topology or updates an existing service topology.

parameters.name: serviceTopologyInfo
parameters.description: Source topology object defines the resource.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard Error contract.
All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

204.description: The topology was not found and the operation is considered success.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

get.summary: Lists the service topologies in the resource group.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

put.summary: Creates or updates a service in the service topology.
put.description: Synchronously creates a new service or updates an existing service.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.
All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

204.description: The service was not found and the operation is considered success.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

get.summary: Lists the services in the service topology.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

put.summary: Creates or updates a service unit under the service in the service topology.
put.description: This is an asynchronous operation and can be polled to completion using the operation resource returned by this operation.

201.description: This is a long running operation. The operation returns a 201 if the validation is complete. The response includes an Azure-AsyncOperation header that contains a status URL. Clients are expected to poll the status URL for the status of the operation.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: Contains the status URL on which clients are expected to poll the status of the operation.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.
All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

200.description: The service unit was successfully deleted.

204.description: The service unit was not found and the operation is considered success.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

get.summary: Lists the service units under a service in the service topology.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

put.summary: Creates or updates a rollout step with the given step properties.
put.description: Synchronously creates a new step or updates an existing step.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.
All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

204.description: The step was not found and the operation is considered success.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

get.summary: Lists the steps in a resource group.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

put.description: This is an asynchronous operation and can be polled to completion using the location header returned by this operation.

parameters.name: rolloutRequest
parameters.description: Source rollout request object that defines the rollout.

201.description: This is a long running operation. The operation returns a 201 if the request was successfully registered and basic validation is successful. The response includes an Azure-AsyncOperation header that contains the operation status URL. Clients are expected to poll the status URL for the status of the operation.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: Contains the status URL on which clients are expected to poll the status of the operation.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

get.summary: Gets detailed information of a rollout.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

delete.description: Only rollouts in terminal state can be deleted.

204.description: The rollout was not found and the operation is considered success.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

post.description: Only running rollouts can be canceled.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

post.summary: Restarts a failed rollout and optionally skips all succeeded steps.
post.description: Only failed rollouts can be restarted.

parameters.name: skipSucceeded
parameters.description: If true, will skip all succeeded steps so far in the rollout. If false, will execute the entire rollout again regardless of the current state of individual resources. Defaults to false if not specified.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

get.summary: Lists the rollouts in a resource group.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

put.summary: Creates or updates an artifact source.
put.description: Synchronously creates a new artifact source or updates an existing artifact source.

parameters.name: artifactSourceInfo
parameters.description: Source object that defines the resource.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.
All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

200.description: The artifact source was successfully deleted.

204.description: The artifact source was not found and the operation is considered success.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

get.summary: Lists the artifact sources in a resource group.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

200.description: The operations are successfully returned. The response code does not determine if the request which this operation corresponds to is successful. Check the response content for the status and any error information on failures.

default.description: All non-success conditions are handled using the standard error contract.

RolloutRequest.description: Defines the PUT rollout request body.

properties.description: Defines the properties that make up a rollout request.

RolloutRequestProperties.description: The properties for defining a rollout.

buildVersion.description: The version of the build being deployed.

artifactSourceId.description: The reference to the artifact source resource Id where the payload is located.

targetServiceTopologyId.description: The resource Id of the service topology from which service units are being referenced in step groups to be deployed.

stepGroups.description: The list of step groups that define the orchestration.

StepGroup.description: The properties that define a Step group in a rollout.

name.description: The name of the step group.

dependsOnStepGroups.description: The list of step group names on which this step group depends on.

preDeploymentSteps.description: The list of steps to be run before deploying the target.

deploymentTargetId.description: The resource Id of service unit to be deployed. The service unit should be from the service topology referenced in targetServiceTopologyId

postDeploymentSteps.description: The list of steps to be run after deploying the target.

PrePostStep.description: The properties that define a step.

stepId.description: The resource Id of the step to be run.

ArtifactSource.description: The resource that defines the source location where the artifacts are located.

properties.description: The properties that define the artifact source.

ArtifactSourceProperties.description: The properties that define the source location where the artifacts are located.

sourceType.description: The type of artifact source used.

artifactRoot.description: The path from the location that the 'authentication' property [say, a SAS URI to the blob container] refers to, to the location of the artifacts. This can be used to differentiate different versions of the artifacts. Or, different types of artifacts like binaries or templates. The location referenced by the authentication property concatenated with this optional artifactRoot path forms the artifact source location where the artifacts are expected to be found.

authentication.description: The authentication method to use to access the artifact source.

Authentication.description: Defines the authentication method and properties to access the artifacts.

SasAuthentication.description: Defines the properties to access the artifacts using an Azure Storage SAS URI.

SasProperties.description: The properties that define SAS authentication.

sasUri.description: The SAS URI to the Azure Storage blob container. Any offset from the root of the container to where the artifacts are located can be defined in the artifactRoot.

properties.description: The properties that define a rollout.

RolloutProperties.description: Defines the properties of a rollout.

status.description: The current status of the rollout.

totalRetryAttempts.description: The cardinal count of total number of retries performed on the rollout at a given time.

services.description: The detailed information on the services being deployed.

RolloutOperationInfo.description: Detailed runtime information of the rollout.

retryAttempt.description: The ordinal count of the number of retry attempts on a rollout. 0 if no retries of the rollout have been performed. If the rollout is updated with a PUT, this count is reset to 0.

skipSucceededOnRetry.description: True, if all steps that succeeded on the previous run/attempt were chosen to be skipped in this retry attempt. False, otherwise.

startTime.description: The start time of the rollout in UTC.

endTime.description: The start time of the rollout in UTC. This property will not be set if the rollout has not completed yet.

error.description: The detailed error information for any failure.

ServiceTopologyResource.description: The resource representation of a service topology.

properties.description: The properties that define the service topology.

ServiceTopologyProperties.description: The properties of a service topology.

artifactSourceId.description: The resource Id of the artifact source that contains the artifacts that can be referenced in the service units.

ServiceResource.description: The resource representation of a service in a service topology.

properties.description: The properties that define a service in a service topology.

serviceUnits.description: The detailed information about the units that make up the service.

targetLocation.description: The Azure location to which the resources in the service belong to or should be deployed to.

targetSubscriptionId.description: The subscription to which the resources in the service belong to or should be deployed to.

ServiceUnitResource.description: Represents the response of a service unit resource.

properties.description: The properties that define the service unit.

ServiceUnitProperties.description: Defines the properties of a service unit.

targetResourceGroup.description: The Azure Resource Group to which the resources in the service unit belong to or should be deployed to.

deploymentMode.description: Describes the type of ARM deployment to be performed on the resource.

artifacts.description: The artifacts for the service unit.

ServiceUnitArtifacts.description: Defines the artifacts of a service unit.

templateUri.description: The full URI of the ARM template file with the SAS token.

parametersUri.description: The full URI of the ARM parameters file with the SAS token.

templateArtifactSourceRelativePath.description: The path to the ARM template file relative to the artifact source.

parametersArtifactSourceRelativePath.description: The path to the ARM parameters file relative to the artifact source.

RolloutStep.description: Defines a specific step on a target service unit.

stepGroup.description: The step group the current step is part of.

operationInfo.description: Detailed information of specific action execution.

resourceOperations.description: Set of resource operations that were performed, if any, on an Azure resource.

StepOperationInfo.description: Detailed information of a specific step run.

deploymentName.description: The name of the ARM deployment initiated as part of the step.

correlationId.description: Unique identifier to track the request for ARM-based resources.

startTime.description: Start time of the action in UTC.

endTime.description: End time of the action in UTC.

lastUpdatedTime.description: Last time in UTC this operation was updated.

error.description: The errors, if any, for the action.

resourceName.description: Name of the resource as specified in the artifacts. For ARM resources, this is the name of the resource specified in the template.

operationId.description: Unique identifier of the operation. For ARM resources, this is the operationId obtained from ARM service.

resourceType.description: Type of the resource as specified in the artifacts. For ARM resources, this is the type of the resource specified in the template.

provisioningState.description: State of the resource deployment. For ARM resources, this is the current provisioning state of the resource.

statusMessage.description: Descriptive information of the resource operation.

statusCode.description: Http status code of the operation.

Message.description: Supplementary contextual messages during a rollout.

timeStamp.description: Time in UTC this message was provided.

error.description: The properties that define the error.

CloudErrorBody.description: Detailed error information of any failure.

Operation.description: Represents an operation that can be performed on the service.

display.description: The display name of the operation.

provider.description: The name of the provider that supports the operation.

resource.description: The resource type on which this operation can be performed.

StepResource.description: The resource representation of a rollout step.

properties.description: The properties that define the step.

StepProperties.description: The properties of a step resource.

HealthCheckStepProperties.description: Defines the properties of a health check step.

HealthCheckStepAttributes.description: The attributes for the health check step.

waitDuration.description: The duration in ISO 8601 format for which health check waits idly without any checks.

maxElasticDuration.description: The duration in ISO 8601 format for which the health check waits for the resource to become healthy. Health check fails if it doesn't. Health check starts to enforce healthyStateDuration once resource becomes healthy.

healthyStateDuration.description: The duration in ISO 8601 format for which the resource is expected to be continuously healthy. If maxElasticDuration is specified, healthy state duration is enforced after the detection of first healthy signal.

RestHealthCheckStepAttributes.description: Defines the REST health check step properties.

RestParameters.description: The parameters for the REST health check.

healthChecks.description: The list of checks that form the health check step.

name.description: A unique name for this check.

request.description: The request to the health provider.

response.description: The expected response from the health provider. If no expected response is provided, the default is to expect the received response to have an HTTP status code of 200 OK.

RestRequest.description: The properties that make up a REST request

method.description: The HTTP method to use for the request.

uri.description: The HTTP URI to use for the request.

authentication.description: The authentication information required in the request to the health provider.

RestRequestAuthentication.description: The authentication information required in the REST health check request to the health provider.

RolloutIdentityAuthentication.description: RolloutIdentity uses the user-assigned managed identity authentication context specified in the Identity property during rollout creation.

ApiKeyAuthentication.description: ApiKey authentication gives a name and a value that can be included in either the request header or query parameters.

name.description: The key name of the authentication key/value pair.

in.description: The location of the authentication key/value pair in the request.

value.description: The value of the authentication key/value pair.

RestResponse.description: The properties that make up the expected REST response

successStatusCodes.description: The HTTP status codes expected in a successful health check response. The response is expected to match one of the given status codes. If no expected status codes are provided, default expected status code is 200 OK.

regex.description: The regular expressions to match the response content with.

matchQuantifier.description: Indicates whether any or all of the expressions should match with the response content.

WaitStepProperties.description: Defines the properties of a Wait step.

WaitStepAttributes.description: The parameters for the wait step.

duration.description: The duration in ISO 8601 format of how long the wait should be.

artifactSourceName.description: The name of the artifact source.
artifactSourceName.name: artifactSourceName

serviceTopologyName.name: serviceTopologyName
serviceTopologyName.description: The name of the service topology .

serviceName.name: serviceName
serviceName.description: The name of the service resource.

serviceUnitName.name: serviceUnitName
serviceUnitName.description: The name of the service unit resource.

stepName.name: stepName
stepName.description: The name of the deployment step.

subscriptionId.name: subscriptionId
subscriptionId.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

resourceGroupName.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.
resourceGroupName.name: resourceGroupName

retryAttempt.name: retryAttempt
retryAttempt.description: Rollout retry attempt ordinal to get the result of. If not specified, result of the latest attempt will be returned.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for this operation.
